s.text: A 1996 study commissioned by the FAA analyzed a decade's worth of inflight instrument-malfunction reports and could not trace a single incident to a cell phone.
So strong, reports the LAT , that many corporate recruiters are doing something unprecedented: hiring liberal-arts graduates.
How strong is the nation's economy?

Both Airbus and Boeing have bombarded their planes with cell waves and failed to record any interference; Boeing still recommends that phones not be used in the air--but to prevent electronic interference similar to (though slightly stronger than) that of a laptop or CD player.
